etymology.interpretation: Refers to Taipei’s administrative district named after Sun Yat-sen (Sun Zhongshan). Here 中山 denotes his honorific rather than a literal “central mountain.”
etymology.simplification: 區 → 区 was simplified in the PRC by collapsing internal components during character reform; Taiwan retains the traditional form in official names, so 中山區 is used there.

parts.english: Zhongshan; Sun Yat-sen (moniker); place name; central mountain (literal)

examples.chinese: 我住在台北市中山区(我住在臺北市中山區)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Táiběi Shì Zhōngshān Qū.
examples.english: I live in Zhongshan District, Taipei City.

examples.chinese: 中山区有许多咖啡馆和百货公司(中山區有許多咖啡館和百貨公司)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngshān Qū yǒu xǔduō kāfēiguǎn hé bǎihuò gōngsī.
examples.english: Zhongshan District has many cafés and department stores.

examples.chinese: 我们从松山机场到中山区只要十五分钟(我們從松山機場到中山區只要十五分鐘)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cóng Sōngshān Jīchǎng dào Zhōngshān Qū zhǐ yào shíwǔ fēnzhōng.
examples.english: It only takes fifteen minutes for us to get from Songshan Airport to Zhongshan District.
